description:
/sp.book-layout

Title: Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics  
Subtitle: A Complete Guide to Embodied Intelligence, Simulation, and Control

Objective:
Provide a full roadmap for students to learn humanoid robotics, ROS 2, simulation platforms, NVIDIA Isaac, and Vision-Language-Action systems through a structured, module-based book.

=========================================
MODULE 1 — FOUNDATIONS OF PHYSICAL AI
(Chapters 1–3)
=========================================

Chapter 1: Introduction to Physical AI
- Definition & scope
- Embodied intelligence vs digital AI
- Why robots need physical perception
- Examples of modern humanoid robots

Chapter 2: Sensors & Perception Systems
- RGB, depth, LiDAR, IMU, ultrasonic sensors
- Force/torque sensors
- Sensor fusion basics
- Perception pipeline overview

Chapter 3: Robotics Hardware & Lab Architecture
- Workstation requirements (GPU/CPU/RAM)
- Jetson Orin overview
- Humanoid options: G1, OP3, TonyPi
- Digital Twin setup
- Lab safety & sensor mounting basics

=========================================
MODULE 2 — ROS 2: THE ROBOTIC NERVOUS SYSTEM
(Chapters 4–6)
=========================================

Chapter 4: ROS 2 Architecture
- ROS graph, nodes, topics, services, actions
- DDS middleware & communication
- TF and coordinate transforms

Chapter 5: Building ROS 2 Applications
- Workspace & packages
- Writing nodes in Python
- Launch files & parameters
- Debugging & testing nodes

Chapter 6: URDF & Robot Descriptions
- URDF fundamentals
- Links, joints, collision, inertia
- XACRO & parameterized models
- Validating robots with RViz & Gazebo

=========================================
MODULE 3 — SIMULATION: THE DIGITAL TWIN
(Chapters 7–8)
=========================================

Chapter 7: Gazebo Simulation
- Physics engines
- Collisions, joints, mass, inertia
- Simulating sensors
- Spawning URDF robots

Chapter 8: Unity for Robotics
- High-fidelity simulation
- Importing robots into Unity
- Unity physics for robotics
- Human-robot interaction scenes

=========================================
MODULE 4 — NVIDIA ISAAC PLATFORM (AI FOR ROBOTS)
(Chapters 9–11)
=========================================

Chapter 9: Isaac Sim Foundations
- Omniverse platform
- USD assets & scene graph
- Isaac Sim interface
- Dataset generation

Chapter 10: Perception & Manipulation with Isaac ROS
- Object detection & pose estimation
- Depth & stereo vision
- Manipulation workflows
- Integration with ROS 2

Chapter 11: VSLAM & Navigation
- Visual SLAM
- Isaac ROS VSLAM setup
- Localization and mapping
- Nav2 for humanoids

=========================================
MODULE 5 — HUMANOID ROBOT DESIGN & CONTROL
(Chapters 12–13)
=========================================

Chapter 12: Humanoid Kinematics & Dynamics
- Forward & inverse kinematics
- Bipedal locomotion
- Balance & stability control

Chapter 13: Manipulation & Grasping
- Arm and hand kinematics
- Grip strategies
- Object interaction fundamentals

=========================================
MODULE 6 — VISION-LANGUAGE-ACTION (VLA)
(Chapters 14–15)
=========================================

Chapter 14: Conversational Robotics
- LLM integration with robots
- Speech recognition (Whisper)
- NLU for physical tasks

Chapter 15: Cognitive Planning
- Converting high-level commands to action sequences
- LLM-to-ROS mapping
- Multi-step task planning

=========================================
MODULE 7 — CAPSTONE PROJECT: AUTONOMOUS HUMANOID
(Chapter 16)
=========================================

Chapter 16: Full Humanoid Workflow
- Voice → VLA → ROS 2 actions
- Navigation + manipulation integrated
- Sim-to-real deployment
- Final project guidelines

=========================================
APPENDICES
=========================================

Appendix A: Hardware Setup  
Appendix B: Software Installation (Ubuntu, ROS 2, Isaac Sim)  
Appendix C: Troubleshooting & FAQs  
Appendix D: Cloud Robotics & Omniverse Cloud
